questions.question: What is a document-term matrix (DTM) in NLP?

options.A: A table where each cell stores the definition of a word
options.B: A vector-space representation of a corpus of text
options.C: A list of grammar rules for natural language
options.D: A series of translations between languages

questions.question: **(Medium) ** Which of the following are possible representations of values in a DTM?
What is typically the most common value in a sparse document-term matrix?
**(Medium) ** What information can you directly obtain from a DTM by summing rows or columns?

options.B: Most popular words in the corpus

questions.question: Why is vocabulary selection important when constructing a DTM?

options.A: It determines which words become columns in the matrix
options.B: It prevents the DTM from being dense and computationally inefficient
options.C: It ensures rare and common words are treated the same
options.D: It improves the accuracy of word vectors

questions.question: **(Hard) ** What are advantages of sparse matrices in the context of DTMs?

options.A: They require less memory to store
options.D: They are easier to interpret visually
